abstract: Former HSBC Holdings executive Chen Ching-hsiao was sentenced to 20 months in prison by a Hong Kong court for taking a bribe from a Taiwanese client seeking credit facilities.
snippet: Former HSBC Holdings executive Chen Ching-hsiao was sentenced to 20 months in prison by a Hong Kong court for taking a bribe from a Taiwanese client seeking credit facilities.
lead_paragraph: A former HSBC Holdings executive, Chen Ching-hsiao, was sentenced to 20 months in prison by a Hong Kong court for taking a bribe from a Taiwanese client seeking credit facilities, Bloomberg News reported.

headline.main: Ex-HSBC Official Goes to Prison for Bribe-Taking
